description.en:
During the course the main principles and theories about a formation of social policy are presented. Course deals with different factors and groups in policy formation process. The effectiveness of those factors is analysed.
Also different theories, about the development of policy process, public decision making and economic and social effectiveness of all process are analysed. During the course students get an introductory guideline into cost-benefit analyses. Classical public policy dilemmas - free rider,
prisons dilemma and other are discussed in the light of policy process.
description.et: Kursus käsitleb avaliku poliitika formeerumist ja arengut, erilise rõhuga sotsiaalpoliitikale. Erinevad huvigrupid, institutsioonid ja teised mõjurid poliitikas. Tegurid, mis määravad ideede, survegruppide edukuse. Erinevad teooriad poliitika arengu kohta, avalikud otsused, poliitikate efektiivsus, avaliku poliitika majanduslik  efektiivsus, avaliku poliitika sotsiaalne efektiivsus. Klassikalised avaliku poliitika dilemmad - " free rider", vangide dilemma jt.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide main instruments and knowledge in order to analyse social policy process and it's outcomes.
objectives.et:
Anda peamised instrumendid ja teadmised sotsiaalpoliitika
analüüsimiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: The students know the main approaches and theories of social policy analyses.
learning_outcomes.et: Tudengid teavad peamisi teooriaid ja võtteid sotsiaalpoliitika analüüsimiseks.

independent_work.et: An assignment after every lecture. The instructions will be provided in the lecture and in the Moodle.

debt_elimination.et: Usually no. Special cases requires pre-consultation with a lecturer.

description.et:
What is social policy analyses and when we need them?
You can start studies in MOODLE, but we shall meet also in Lossi 36, room 207 (this is optional).
Theories about the policy process. Theories about decision making.
Policy implementation. Policy assessment and measurement problems
Tools (EUROMOD) and problems with policy analyses

Analyses of policy papers. Individual work
1. The title and the aim of the paper (2 sentences)
2. Describe the method (Sample - who or what is analysed, method of analyses)
3. 1-2 sentences about the results
4. How is it related to policy analyses
5. Comparison with other papers

Different types of cost- benefit analyses (2)
Consultation
